title: The yuan's status as a global currency might be gaining ground. But top CEOs see more hurdles to clear
content: For China's yuan to be used more globally, the currency needs more "applications" such as stocks and bonds, said Bonnie Chan, CEO of the Hong Kong exchange.
summary: For China's yuan to be used more globally, the currency needs more "applications" such as stocks and bonds, said Bonnie Chan, CEO of the Hong Kong exchange.

title: Europe is at risk of over-restricting AI and falling behind U.S. and China, Dutch prince says
content: Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands told CNBC Europe risks limiting its role in artificial intelligence to being a regulator, rather than an innovator.
summary: Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands told CNBC Europe risks limiting its role in artificial intelligence to being a regulator, rather than an innovator.

title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange walks free after reaching U.S. plea deal, bound for Australia
content: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange on Wednesday walked free after pleading guilty in a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands, a U.S. commonwealth in the Pacific.
summary: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange on Wednesday walked free after pleading guilty in a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands, a U.S. commonwealth in the Pacific.

title: Nvidia's half-a-trillion dollar wipeout leaves global chip stocks volatile
content: Global semiconductor stocks saw volatile trading on Tuesday after a slump in shares of Nvidia during the previous session.
summary: Global semiconductor stocks saw volatile trading on Tuesday after a slump in shares of Nvidia during the previous session.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Nvidia rebounds after $500 billion slump

title: This Southeast Asian city is the world's most expensive for the super rich — Hong Kong comes second
content: The price of owning a car in Singapore — the most expensive globally at 2.5 times the average — soared 15% from a year earlier in U.S. dollar terms.
summary: The price of owning a car in Singapore — the most expensive globally at 2.5 times the average — soared 15% from a year earlier in U.S. dollar terms.

title: Britain looks to upstage France with play for world's third major AI hub after U.S., China
content: Global tech entrepreneurs and investors are touting the U.K. as a place to invest in when it comes to artificial intelligence. But it faces competition.
summary: Global tech entrepreneurs and investors are touting the U.K. as a place to invest in when it comes to artificial intelligence. But it faces competition.

title: Harvard dropouts raise $120 million to take on Nvidia's AI chips
content: A team founded by college dropouts has raised $120 million from investors led by Primary Venture Partners to build a new AI chip to take on Nvidia.
summary: A team founded by college dropouts has raised $120 million from investors led by Primary Venture Partners to build a new AI chip to take on Nvidia.

title: Delta's most exclusive airport lounge opens. Here's what's inside
content: The Delta One lounge is the airline's latest effort to reel in customers and offers perks like massages, showers and a high-end restaurant.
summary: The Delta One lounge is the airline's latest effort to reel in customers and offers perks like massages, showers and a high-end restaurant.

title: U.S. ambassador accuses China of undermining bilateral ties, Wall Street Journal reports
content: This comes after ties between the U.S. and China have somewhat warmed after Xi and Biden met in November.
summary: This comes after ties between the U.S. and China have somewhat warmed after Xi and Biden met in November.

title: Rivian secures up to $5 billion from Volkswagen, shares soar more than 50%
content: Volkswagen plans to invest up to $5 billion in electric vehicle startup Rivian, starting with an initial investment of $1 billion.
summary: Volkswagen plans to invest up to $5 billion in electric vehicle startup Rivian, starting with an initial investment of $1 billion.

title: Sixteen Nobel Prize-winning economists warn a second Trump term would 'reignite' inflation
content: Trump says he would make his first-term tax cuts permanent, impose universal tariffs on all imports and pressure the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.
summary: Trump says he would make his first-term tax cuts permanent, impose universal tariffs on all imports and pressure the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.

title: Novo Nordisk's Wegovy weight loss drug approved in China
content: Novo Nordisk said Tuesday that its Wegovy weight loss treatment has been approved in China for long-term weight management.
summary: Novo Nordisk said Tuesday that its Wegovy weight loss treatment has been approved in China for long-term weight management.

title: China’s Chang’e-6 lunar probe returns with first-ever samples from far side of the moon
content: China's Chang'e-6 lunar probe returned to Earth on Tuesday, bringing back the first-ever samples from the far side of the moon.
summary: China's Chang'e-6 lunar probe returned to Earth on Tuesday, bringing back the first-ever samples from the far side of the moon.

title: Cisco is 'very optimistic' about its expanding business with China EVs
content: Cisco is "very optimistic" about its growing business with Chinese electric car companies as they expand overseas, Cisco's Greater China head Ming Wong told CNBC.
summary: Cisco is "very optimistic" about its growing business with Chinese electric car companies as they expand overseas, Cisco's Greater China head Ming Wong told CNBC.

title: Tesla recalls Cybertruck to fix faulty windshield wipers, loose trim
content: Tesla has issued its third and fourth recalls on its Cybertruck, which hit the market late last year.
summary: Tesla has issued its third and fourth recalls on its Cybertruck, which hit the market late last year.

title: New photos show Trump's 'haphazard' storage of classified documents, special counsel says
content: The former president and likely GOP nominee is charged with retaining classified documents after his presidency ended and then hiding them from authorities.

content: Chinese Premier Li Qiang on Tuesday defended the country's technological development while criticizing efforts to restrict global cooperation.

title: German airline Lufthansa hikes ticket prices by up to $77 due to environmental costs

title: I'm an exec in Finland, the happiest country in the world—3 ways my company closed our gender wage gap

content: FedEx shares jumped 15% after hours as the company begins to bear the fruits of its $4 billion cost-cutting plan.

title: U.S. auto sales are expected to slow during the second half of 2024

title: China employing 'gray zone tactics' at contested Second Thomas Shoal, Lowy Institute's Yaacob says

title: Fed Governor Bowman says she's still open to raising rates if inflation doesn't improve
content: Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said Tuesday the time is not right yet to start lowering interest rates.
